name: Standby
description:
Our debut full-length! 12 tracks that will have you hitting or clicking the repeat button.

"“Standby” is a stellar pop album that should be widely embraced by radio for its outstanding guitar rock and quirky vocal deliveries." ~ Dan Goldin, Exploding In Sound

"What's equally impressive is Ex-Norwegian's ability to flirt with a radio-ready stance...With those kinds of credentials, Standby can be recommended without reservation." ~ Lee Zimmerman, Miami New Times

"Some of the standouts not to be missed-the Meat Puppets inspired track “Add Vice” and the crunchy “Fujeira In My Dreams.” ~ Alex Rendon, Closer Mag

name: Dance Trance Pants/Don't Bother 7"
description:
For those audiophiles, enjoy a limited vinyl pressing of our second single, "Dance Trance Pants" with our favorite -b- side "Don't Bother". Sure to get your parties started!

"...steady stomp and surge of "Dance Trance Pants" testify to the band's revved-up delivery and sonic savvy." ~ Miami New Times

NOTE: No picture sleeve! Ships in white plain sleeve.

name: Tour Poster
description:
For the real Ex Norwegian head, we have "In Concert" tour posters available...as used on our spring/summer 2009 tours.

NOTE: The poster is mint, not used, LOL.

name: Sketch Deluxe (CD+DVD)
description: Sketch Deluxe is our latest album Sketch with a bonus DVD featuring a live performance of the entire album. 1. Jet Lag 2. Smashing Time 3. Mind Down 4. Sky Diving 5. You're Elastic Over Me 6. Seconds 7. Upper Hand 8. Turn Left 9. Acting On An Island 10. Tired Of Dancing The live DVD was captured at Miami's Sweat Records on June 19, 2010. DVD extras include audio commentary, music and live video. "Sketch belies its title. In truth, it's more a masterpiece." — Lee Zimmerman, Broward/Palm Beach New Times "[Sketch] is an otherworldly slab of catchy pop rock song after catchy pop rock song, conceived in some fantastic place where the ’90s power pop bubble never burst." — Ed - Ed's Music "Sketch performs a neat trick — it improves on something that, before the release of this album, didn’t seem to need improving." — Dan Sweeney - CityLink
